item.text: Problem: Research has shown that the inability to look out over natural scenes makes us more ill.

Discussion: Research by Ulrich (1984) showed surgical patients with views of nature had shorter post-operative stays, fewer negative comments from nurses, took less pain medication and experienced fewer minor post-operative complications than those with a view of a brick wall.

Discussion: Research by Ulrich (1984) showed surgical patients with views of nature had shorter post-operative stays, fewer negative comments from nurses, took less pain medication and experienced fewer minor post-operative complications than those with a view of a brick wall. [[Citations]]

<b>Therefore: Make sure that each room has a view to a natural scene: green vegetation, water, sunlight.  If the building is in an urban setting, create a courtyard garden, or use small window atria. <b>
